{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient in this case had a drop in blood pressure and tachycardia 30 minutes after delivery, which suggests postpartum hemorrhage. The boggy uterus also supports this diagnosis. Aggressive fluid resuscitation was initiated, and the patient's vitals stabilized. However, the next morning, she is unable to lactate when she tries to breastfeed. This suggests that she may have insufficient milk production, which can be caused by retained placental tissue in the uterus. The most likely cause of the failure of lactation in this patient is B. Remains of placenta in uterus.", "answer_choice": "B"}
